Detailed Description

This header defines the GTI APIs for resetting the target device.

Copyright (c) 1998-2015, Texas Instruments Inc., All rights reserved.

Define Documentation

#define GTI_RESET_INFO_REV   0x1

Revision of the GTI_RESET_INFO structure.

#define GTI_RESET_REQUIRES_ALL_DISCONNECTED   (0x08)

Reset requires all targets are disconnected.

#define GTI_RESET_REQUIRES_CONNECTION   (0x02)

Reset requires the target is connected.

#define GTI_RESET_REQUIRES_DISCONNECTION   (0x04)

Reset requires the target is disconnected.

#define GTI_RESET_REQUIRES_HALT   (0x01)

Reset requires the target is halted.

#define GTI_RESET_REQUIRES_NONE   (0x00)

Flags to define the requirements to use a reset for GTI_GET_RESET_INFO().

Reset requires no special conditions.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum GTI_BLOCK_RESET_TYPE

Flags to control the block reset mode used by GTI_BLOCK_RESET().

Enumerator:
GTI_BLOCK_RESET_OFF 

Disable block reset mode, apply resets normally.

GTI_BLOCK_RESET_ONCE 

Set block reset mode to block resets one time only.

GTI_BLOCK_RESET_STAY 

Set block reset mode to block all resets.

Function Documentation

GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_BLOCK_RESET ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_BLOCK_RESET_TYPE  nBlockMode 
)

GTI_BLOCK_RESET() - Set the block reset mode.

Set the block reset mode of the device. Block reset mode causes the parent router of the device (e.g. ICEPick router) to intercept hardware resets and prevent them from being seen by the device. WIR mode must be disabled prior to using block reset mode. Set nBlockMode to the desired GTI_BLOCK_RESET_TYPE to set the mode.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_EMURESET_EX ( GTI_PORT_TYPE  portAddress,
GTI_STRING_TYPE  parmFileName 
)

GTI_EMURESET_EX() - Reset the debug probe.

This call does a JTAG reset on the target debug probe specified in the board config file passed in via parmFileName. This call can only be made when no targets are currently connected to the debug probe.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]portAddressDebug probe port address (unused).
[in]parmFileNamePath and name of board config file.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_UINT32_TYPE GTI_GET_NUM_RESETS ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid )

GTI_GET_NUM_RESETS() - Get number of reset types available for this device.

This call returns the number of reset types available for this driver and target device. Use this number with GTI_GET_RESET_INFO() to build a list of available reset types that can be used with GTI_RESET_EX().

Returns:
number of reset types available for this device.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_GET_RESET_INFO ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE  nResetID,
GTI_RESET_INFO *  pInfo 
)

GTI_GET_RESET_INFO() - Get details for each available reset type.

This call fills in a GTI_RESET_INFO structure with the details of the reset type requested by the nResetID index. Use GTI_GET_NUM_RESETS() to determine the range of legal reset indices for this target device.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]nResetIDIndex to the reset to get info on.
[out]pInfoPointer to return info about the reset.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_GET_WAIT_IN_RESET_MODE ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_BOOL *  bWIREnable 
)

GTI_GET_WAIT_IN_RESET() - Get the wait-in-reset (WIR) mode.

Returns the current wait-in-reset (WIR) mode setting of the device. WIR mode causes the device to remain halted at the reset vector after a reset. Returns TRUE if WIR mode is on, FALSE if it is off.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error. Current setting is returned in bWIREnable.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[out]bWIREnablePointer to return current WIR mode setting.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_RESET ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid )

GTI_RESET() - Reset target device.

This function resets the device. The type of reset performed depends on the specific device driver, but usually this is a software only reset.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_RESET_EX ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE  nResetID 
)

GTI_RESET_EX() - Reset target device.

This function resets the device using nResetID to request the specific type of reset to use. The supported types of resets are determined by using the GTI_GET_NUM_RESETS() and GTI_GET_RESET_INFO() calls.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]nResetIDIndex to the type of reset to use.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_SET_WAIT_IN_RESET ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_BOOL  bWIREnable 
)

GTI_SET_WAIT_IN_RESET() - Set the wait-in-reset (WIR) mode.

Turns on or off the wait-in-reset (WIR) mode of the device. WIR mode causes the device to remain halted at the reset vector after a reset. Set bWIREnable to TRUE to turn on WIR mode, FALSE to turn off WIR mode.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]bWIREnableFlag to turn on or off WIR mode.
